Title: Sr ETL / Tableau Developer
Description:
We are a fast growing organization that is one of the most trusted companies worldwide.  We focus on the development of robust delivery and distribution tools through the use of technology.  Our significant growth and ability to continuously win new business is largely based on the level of flexibility and customization our technology offers.If you are a Sr ETL / Tableau Developer with experience, please read on!What You Will Be DoingAs Sr. ETL/Tableau Developer on the team, you will be working with BI team to design, develop, implement and document data integration processes, as well as influence the long-term evolution of our analytics capability. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with traditional Data Warehouse concept. The candidate should have excellent communication skills and able to work with product owner to develop and define technical requirements. The candidate should have good knowledge and working experience with Tableau.What You Need for this Position•5+ years experience implementing ETL for Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Solution•7+ Years experience in RDBMS design, development and performance tuning•Ability to create ETL specifications, unit, and system integration test cases•Build reusable components for a scalable ETL methodology such as error handling, logging and recoverability•Deep familiarity with MS SQL Server 2008 R2 to MS SQL Server 2014 database technologies and ETL best practices with MS SQL Server environment•Ability to read and write effective, modular, dynamic (parameterized) and robust code, establish and follow already established code standards, and ETL framework•Experience using Business Intelligence Development Studio to build SSIS packages•Excellent troubleshooting & optimization skills: interpreting ETL logs, performing data validation, dissecting SSIS code, understanding the benefits and drawbacks of parallelism, experience with change data capture, using expressions, scoping of variables, commonly used transforms, event handlers and logging providers, ability to understand and optimize the surrogate key generation and inconsistent data type handling.•Experience in performance tuning of the SSIS packages,  deploying and administering SSIS packages, proficient in utilizing scripting in SSIS, and replacing ActiveX script tasks in DTS with the script task in SSIS.•Ability to capture and research SSIS issues and bugs, build sample test jobs that recreate a bug, and troubleshoot the ETL until successful issue resolution.•Experience with creating data sources for Tableau•Experience with creating visuals with Tableau •Responsible for unit, string, and system testing and assisting in development of UAT test plans•Experience with NoSQL databases such Mongo DB is a plusWhat's In It for You•Competitive compensation•Comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits•Supplemental benefit options•Generous Paid Time Off•401(k) Employer ContributionSo, if you are a Sr ETL / Tableau Developer with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

If you have 5+ years of technical software development experience and always dreamed of taking a company to new heights than oh boy do I have an opportunity for YOU! We are a family owned, values driven industrial sand supplier with a team who is passionately pursuing excellence and stakeholder satisfaction. We are committed to producing the highest quality industrial silica sand products, operating our facilities in an environmentally responsible manner, ensuring the health and wellness of our associates and of the communities in which we operate. The sand and coated sand products  that we produce are used in a variety of industrial and environmental applications. If you are a Solutions Architect with experience, please read on!If you are interested in joining a growing company that definitely cares about providing a great working environment for its employees, then apply immediately.**Your application will be considered incomplete unless the screening questions are answered, and incomplete applications cannot be submitted for further review. Please answer all of the screening questions in detail in order to expedite the process.**What You Will Be Doing-Oversight of business requirements, functional architecture and technical architecture of our products-Participate in business development and pre-sales activities including solution development and business demos for multiple opportunities across industry domains-Identify core competencies, innovation strategy and product differentiators to optimize enterprise value chain-Act as primary advocate for Master Data concepts and governance-Work closely with business and technology teams to envision, design and develop complex Master Data Management data models and architecture using business process modeling tools-Develop optimal solutions consistent with long-term vision and strategy for MDM domain for multiple industry verticals;-Work with other engineers to successfully deliver on customer expectations within time and budget by analyzing customer requirements, procedures, and problems to enhance company's products and services-Develop proprietary services such as Match & Merge, Data Quality Management and MDM driven / Interaction Analytics for master data systems using MDM best practices and industry architecture-Recommend the nature and scope of present and future product lines by reviewing product specifications and requirements; appraising new product ideas and product or packaging changes***roughly 50% travel is required***What You Need for this Position-Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical or Electronics Engineering, or a closely related field, plus three years of experience in the job offered or in any related position(s).OR-Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical or Electronics Engineering, or a closely related field, plus at least five years of post-degree, progressively responsible experience in the job offered or in any related position(s).ANDKnowledge and experience with the following:-Java/J2EE-Apache Storm-ElasticSearch-Kibana-Graph DBs -HBase-Kafka-Data Modeling-Data Governance and Quality-Metadata Management-Data Architecture-Business Intelligence and Analytics***roughly 50% travel is required***What's In It for You-$100,000-$150,000 Base Salary (DOE)So, if you are a Solutions Architect with experience, please apply today!

Title: Information Architect
Description:
If you are an Information Architect with experience, please read on!Title: Information ArchitectSalary Range: $90K - $130KLocation: Relocation to St. Louis provided!We are a top tier consulting firm with a 30 year proven track record of success and over 1,000 employees in 7 cities nationwide. You will be developing solutions for unpredictable and varied problems for multiple clients across different industries. We want you to be well-rounded in a broad range of languages with the ability to adapt to new clients and learn as you go.Top Reasons to Work with Us- Work with a variety of clients on a wide range of projects- Zero to extreme minimal turnover - our consultants stick around for the long haul- Interesting/challenging workWhat You Will Be Doing- Creates and designs Information Management solutions- Manages other BI Analysts and Developers throughout project lifecycle- Assists in the design and development of dashboards, reports, and other BI metrics- Acts as lead and subject matter expert for clients, including training, design sessions, workshops and project meetings- Collaborates with clients to design information management and business intelligence solutions- Applies best BI practices, including data manipulation and data visualization- Interacts with the client in both a business and technical capacity- Identifies and documents potential data sources and flows- Analyzes existing Enterprise Data Warehouse structures to determine relevance to business needsWhat You Need for this PositionCollege experience, 10+ years of experience in Information Management, Data Analysis, and Business Intelligence, and knowledge of:- SQL- Data Analysis- Data Structures- Integration tools (DTS, SSIS, Informatica, Data Stage, etc.)- Data modeling/architecture (Operational, Data Warehouse, and Data Mart Design).- CASE tools (ERwin, ORACLE Designer 2000, ER/Studio, etc.).- OLAP tools (Analysis Services, Cognos, Business Objects, etc.)- Reporting tools (Reporting Services, Crystal Reports, ProClarity, etc.)What's In It for You- Relocation to Saint Louis, MO- Extremely comprehensive benefits package- Competitive salary commensurate of experienceSo, if you are an Information Architect with experience, please apply today!

Title: SharePoint Developer (Applications Management)
Description:
We are a diversified media company owning publications in six states as well as owning a number of broadband providers.  Financially secure and well-managed we are positioned to enter new markets such as education, marketing and manufacturing.Technology plays a key role how we operate our businesses and plan for the future.  As such, you will have exposure to a range of technologies such as SharePoint, Power BI, Microsoft Teams and Great Plains.  If you have the ability to develop in SharePoint, you very well may be able to step into a bigger role we have in mind for you.  You will be a developer/manager handling enterprise applications and systems integration.We are looking for someone to managed and develop our enterprise applications.  This will involve working with business users to determine their functional requirements and develop those in our Microsoft stack.  You will be kept on your toes working with our Microsoft Technology stack and integrating with legacy business applications.Top Reasons to Work with UsSolid compensation plus excellent benefits such as three-weeks paid vacation available right away Great company culture, flexible work hours, training provided, wellness programOur broad and varied IT projects will give you expertise across range of industries and technologiesWhat You Will Be DoingThis position is important to our company and is responsible for the successful implementation and integration of business application products across the enterprise from project initiation to full customer production rollout.•Use common tools and industry best practices to accomplish integration between legacy systems and new technology•Prepare complex design, implementation, and maintenance plans for systems•Serve as senior level technical expert on medium and large, complex projects•Use and interpret reports from performance analysis tools to determine infrastructure needs•Create technical documentation, design documents, test case documents and deployments documents•Provides critical (Level 3-4) issue resolution as required.  Serve as business relationship manager and a trusted advisor to business partners across the enterprise.•Provide operational support for all business application systems•Manage and monitors business application integrations with 3rd party integration developers and internal staff•Work with 3rd party SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS providers•Implement best practices and act as a strategic advisor to drive innovation and continuous improvementWhat You Need for this PositionBachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Engineering or another related field•Experience with two or more of the following: Great Plains, SharePoint, Dynamics, Media/Publishing applications, Microsoft Teams, and/or Power BI•MCSA certification in either Web Applications or Universal Windows Platform•Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer -- App Builder preferred•Broad knowledge of and experience with various on premise business applications•Expert knowledge in application functionality and technology to provide technical consulting to business leaders•Experience managing application databases, cloud services, and application integrations•Excellent working understanding of the Microsoft technology stack, including latest cloud computing architecture•Solid understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) processesWhat's In It for YouThis is the best opportunity for any developer skilled in the Microsoft Technology stack.  You will be given management responsibility and can grow your skills across a range of applications and in a variety of vertical markets.  You will be challenged in a professional environment that offers endless opportunity.  In addition to a competitive salary ($80 to $100K) we offer excellent benefits such as three weeks paid vacation, 401K and medical.Interviews are being scheduled now.  So if you are SharePoint Developer, Microsoft stack Developer and/or skilled in Applications Management, please apply today.
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Skills:
Preferred Skills
                
                    
                            
                                
                                    
                                    SharePoint

Title: Accounting Manager
Description:
Sick of working in the grind of public accounting or a bad environment? Are you ready to join a place where you can see rapid growth, high-visibility & be treated like family? We are a multi-state owner, operator and third-party manager of single-family rental housing. We operate in California, Nevada,  North Carolina, Indiana, South Carolina, Arizona, Texas & others with near-term expansion efforts currently underway in the Southeast, Midwest, Arizona and Texas. As of January 2018, we have  assets under management exceeding $2 billion across a portfolio of approximately 16k single-family rental homes(& Growing!) with partners and clients consisting of Wall Street private equity firms and investment banks, family office groups and private syndicates. Come be a part of a rocket ship of a company with over 25 years of industry experience & outstanding growth potential!What You Need for this Position•5+ years related experience, preferably in a property management/real estate/Hotels/Constructions/Commercial setting•Strong experience with Analytics & Reporting, GAAP procedures and principles, Business Intelligence, etc.•Strong knowledge in SQL & Excel •Hands on project management experience•Financial Modeling, large data set & process automation experience•MUST BE a strong leader with experience managing, mentoring, guiding & directing accounting professionals at different levels •Experience managing volume - 10k+ assests is a plus•Strong knowledge of accounting principles •Yardi, Appfolio, Essbase, Hyperion or related financial software experience•Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related & it's great if you have a CPA or an MBA (not required)What You Will Be Doing•Leading a team of accounting professionals (analysts), providing guidance•General ledger & subledger research, analysis & process automation (QoQ, MoM, YoY)•Review, prepare, posting portfolio level journal entries•Providing financial system support, data management, streamlining accounting processWhat's In It for You- Top Pay, benefits, Perks & room for growth- Great work environment where employees are treated like family- Be a key player to our continued success & growth- Make a HUGE impact in our accounting department where you'll have a ton of visibility within our company & our parent companySo, if you are an accounting manager with relevant industry & leadership experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Lead Java Engineer - SOA, Micro-Services

Title: Project Manager (Digital Advertising)
Description:
If you are a Digital Project Manager who is bi-lingual in Spanish and English, please read on! We are growing rapidly need a super star to join our team.We are a leader in the Ad Networking space, based in New York! Founded a few years ago, we're making strong connections with our advertisers and targeted communities across the United States. We are leveraging targetable data optimized with a creative inventory. Our platform can effectively reach more targeted communities than anyone else nationwide.  We have a top 10 comscore rating for our industry and are committed to changing the industry two steps at a time. We believe in creating a work culture and environment that allows our teams to grow personally and professionally. We seek the best and brightest in the industry to join our team. We are currently hiring a Digital Project Manager. In this role you will have ownership and the opportunity to make an impact from day one! If you are ready to take the next step in your career, we are your next home.Top Reasons to Work with Us1. We are a leader in the Ad Network space.2. Join a world-class team.3. Experience exponential personal and professional growth!What You Will Be DoingAs the Digital Project Manager you will be responsible for daily logistics between multiple parties to ensure projects are on schedule and on budget. It's important to adhere to our white glove client approach providing a high level of consistent quality.Other responsibilities will include;- Track and document status against timeline and success metrics. - Identify and resolve issues related to the project and ensure they are delivered within scope.- Source, identify and hire talent, such as content producers and social media influencers.- Negotiate agreements with 3rd party freelancers.- Partner with internal account management team to conduct kickoff calls/meetings, weekly status, and daily stand-up meetings.- Create meeting minutes, action logs, timelines, campaign planning and documentation.- Manage costs within budget and work to minimize costs and maximize efficiency and effectiveness.- Create reports in Excel and PowerPoint.What You Need for this Position- Bi-lingual (Spanish and English)- Experience as a Project Manager in a digital advertising company or agency- Strong project management and ability to deal with deadlines- Experience with Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign (CS5/CS4)- Experience with PowerPoint and Excel- Experience working with Omni-channels advertising mediums- Experience with content marketing with a focus on digital, social and experiential in the Latin market - Experience working in a digital agency, ad network or publisher - Experience being detail oriented, solution-driven and organized- Ability to multi-task and prioritize work - Strong qualitative and quantitative analytical skills- Experience forecasting and reporting on KPIs focused on social media and influencer executions is a huge plus!- Comfortable working with colleagues, clients, and consultants in multiple time zones- Experience with Wordpress is a plus!- Knowledge of Content Management Systems (CMS) and Blogging systems are a plus!- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experienceWe are seeking a proactive team player, who likes to get the job done in a fast-paced environment. Someone who is adaptable, confident and strives for excellence is the right person or us!What's In It for You- Medical, dental, vision, disability insurance- 401K matching- Unlimited PTO- Casual Dress Code- Flexible hours- Daily healthy catered lunches, snacks and beverages- Fun company outings (happy hours, holiday parties, etc..)So, if you are a Technical Product Manager with digital advertising experience experience, please apply today!You don't want to miss this Opportunity!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Machine Learning Evangelist - Ai
Description:
If you are a Machine Learning Evangelist with a passion for Ai, please read on!TItle: Machine Learning EvangelistAlternate titles: Director Market Development, AiLocation: San Mateo, CASalary: $200k - $250k + BonusTransforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact. You will be responsible for supporting Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Robotic Process Automation (AI/ML/RPA) Market Development for our organization.  You will be reporting to the Chief Data Officer.What You Will Be DoingYou will be a leader for us! You will energetically promote, market, and develop business opportunities and markets for our organization's AI/ML/RPA solutions and capabilities. You will establish and grow relationships across the healthcare and technology industries, networking with other leaders in the space and generating strategic partnership opportunities that pioneer new imaginative possibilities. You will work across the company, business, operations, and development in identifying and prioritizing Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Robotic Process Automation capabilities.  This role is a senior role requiring interactions with C-suite, Presidents, GMs, Customers, as well as developers and architects.  You will be representing and speaking on behalf of us at AI/ML/RPA events, leading white papers on AI/ML/RPA and Healthcare, and working with Strategy and the Business on AI/ML/RPA capabilities in our existing and future products.What You Need for this PositionMUST HAVE: - Credibility in the Machine Learning/Ai world- Passion- Creativity, Abstract thinker- Strong business senseMUST WANT TO DO:- Evangelize the vision constantly so all stakeholders are aligned, have context, and understand where we are going. - Represent the customer. Be the champion and voice of customers. Build impactful, personal customer relationships. Bring the customer's voice into the creation process. Own requirements, specifications, and release plans.- Be the subject-matter expert (SME) for the AI/ML/RPA segment including a knowledge of the top ecosystem partners that make up our AI/ML/RPA segment globally.- Own the execution of the strategic plan for each market segment, which includes aligning with partner development managers who manage our technology and consulting partners focused on AI/ML/RPA, maximizing influenced revenue.- Working with partner development managers, build C-level relationships with our top partners and generate interest in new programs focused on AI/ML/RPA- Represent the strategy for AI/ML/RPA to our internal and external stakeholders including the sales teams as well as media coverage and industry events focused on the AI/ML/RPA segment- Help prioritize investment in partners who focus on the AI/ML/RPA market segment to drive incremental results- Execute go-to-market and routes-to-market plans that have clear and measurable ROI models- Work collaboratively internally to drive new solutions to market with our product management, solution architect, and professional service teams- Effectively team with communications, marketing, legal, and support- Identify strategic partners that Change Healthcare may want to recruit into the AI/ML/RPA market segment which could include leading startups, consulting companies, and established technology vendorsWhat's In It for You- Learn from the best!- Work for a well-known company who's product is used by billions across the world- Cutting Edge Technologies- Work on large scalable enterprise applications- Large room for advancement within the company- Amazing Health Benefits- Strong Vacation Policy- Strong 401k - Education ReimbursementSo, if you are a Machine Learning Evangelist with experience, please apply today!Or simply e-mail Madeline@cybercoders.com
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Director of Finance- Construction industry
Description:
If you are a Director of Finance and have Construction industry experience, please apply now!! The Director of Finance is primarily responsible for providing financial and accounting leadership and support to assigned markets.  The incumbent will be integral in defining and implementing the most cost effective field finance organization, policies and practices. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, financial analysis, billing and collections, inventory management, and training and supervision of office personnel.What You Will Be Doing•Define most effective field finance organization to support our organization in the most cost effective structure.•Establish and maintain effective internal control practices and processes to ensure that assets are protected and financial reports are accurate.•Develop, implement and maintain effective and efficient policies and practices for the financial management, accounting, working capital, inventory, payroll, and fixed assets systems and functions.•Assists in the annual budget preparation process and periodic forecast updates for the Markets.•Support due diligence efforts on acquisition targets within assigned markets.•Establish and maintain operating statistics and performance indicators that aid in identifying problems and opportunities and facilitate forecasts of future performance.•Maintains accounting records that are up to date and provide management with current revenues, costs, working capital and job profitability.•Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting, with particular focus on accelerating the closing schedule.•Analyze and understand branch performance.  Articulate performance to regional and branch management to assist them in decision-making. •Identifies opportunities to improve business practices and move the branches toward a uniform system of best practices.•Work closely with the Corporate Finance Team to identify, investigate, and analyze potential branch improvements.  As appropriate, based on findings, makes proposal for changes (policy, procedures, processes, etc.). •Develop and maintain a flexible organization that can meet the needs of its supported branches and produce experienced, qualified professionals for future opportunities.•Evaluate the performance of, and provide training and development opportunities for finance and administrative team; define talent succession plan and ensure bench strength.•Support the  branch managers in creating high performance work environments.•Regularly visit branches to keep an accurate pulse on current business conditions.  •Provide leadership and direction to Finance and Administration field staff.  •Plans, directs and manages branch back-office activities in designated market through management and supervision of office staff: ­Accounts Payable?Purchase order preparation and receiver input?Reconciliation of  purchasing card transactions­Accounts Receivable?Customer invoicing, credit memos and monthly customer statements?Credit & collections management, conduct reference checks and obtain liens, as appropriate?Cash application?Customer account issue resolution­Human Resources & Payroll?Human Resources administration including, benefits administration, new hires, employee changes, workers compensation, substance abuse testing, Motor Vehicle Reports, E-Verify, etc.?Time journal entries?Job journal entries­Inventory & Job Scheduling?Provide inventory count support and ensure proper controls are in place?Manage material usage entries, review, and analyze job schedules for accuracy and completeness, making changes/updates as necessary?Analyze job profitability and report positive/negative trends?Audits the work-in-process revenue recognition process to ensure that any jobs with material margin variances from bid are quickly identified and addressed.­Capital Planning and Budgeting?Assist the branches in assessing, budgeting and acquiring capital assets?Assist in the preparation and review of Capital Expenditure Requests.•Additional duties and projects as assigned or delegated.What You Need for this PositionBachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related fieldMinimum (7) seven years relevant work experience Prior supervisory experience requiredProficient knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook)Excellent working knowledge of financial and ERP systemsWell-developed financial analysis capabilities Demonstrated credit and collections management experienceStrong internal financial control experience, budgeting, and financial statement reporting experienceStrong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills;Excellent analytical abilities; Ability to summarize data and analyze resultsSelf-directed, takes initiative in seeking efficiencies of processes; follow-through on implementationDemonstrated analytical skills and problem solving skillsDemonstrated attention to detail and accuracyProven organizational skills; ability to handle several projects concurrently Team player and ability to work with all levels of employeesMust be able to travel 50% of the timeWhat's In It for YouWork for a stable growing company Competitive comp and benefits package work for a family oriented companySo, if you are a Director of Finance with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: CFO/VP of Finance
Description:
If you are a CFO/VP of Finance with experience, please read on!Top Reasons to Work with UsWHO WE AREWe are one of the world’s leading real estate crowdfunding platforms. We provide investors from around the world with the opportunity to invest in institutional quality real estate. We are a vertically integrated investment platform that finances, develops and manages directly or indirectly each of its properties. We also created the first co-working, co-living and social event spaces crowdfunded by its members. Individuals from 27 countries provided over $150 Million of the total $400 Million needed for the construction of the initial three buildings in New York City.What You Will Be DoingESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES-Oversee and constantly improve daily operations of the finance and accountingdepartment ( e.g day-to-day accounting and payables functions, including financialreporting, treasury, risk management, internal controls, and tax compliance on bothcorporate and project levels, etc.)-Oversee and manage cash flow projections and budget / actual variance reports -Oversee and manage the construction budgets reported to the company by each propertymanager, construction manager and/or developer.-Establish, analyze and monitor GAAP financials for each managed fund complex to enable timely month-end, quarterly and annualfinancial reporting.-Manage annual financial and operational audits -Oversee the integration of finance-related activities in the back-office platform,developed by our in-house technology team.-Design, establish, and maintain an organizational structure and staffing to effectivelyaccomplish the department's goals-Manage and oversee third-party administrator-Ensure compliance with reporting requirements for each fund complex in accordancewith offering documents.-Develop, document and implement company-wide accounting policies, procedures, andinternal controls-Effectively communicate financial reports and financial planning needs to the executiveteam with well-thought out recommendations and strategies/What You Need for this PositionKNOWLEDGE, EDUCATION, SKILLS & ABILITIES-C.P.A.-At least 10 years of accounting experience and at least 3 years of accounting experienceat a real estate private equity-Interest and understanding of the fintech industry-Entrepreneurial spirit; willingness and ability to work in a fast paced “start-up”environment-Doer: Ability to execute and “roll up their sleeves”-Ability to clearly communicate both quantitative and qualitative financial information tomanagement to enable efficient decision making-Efficient and organized; ability to work on many projects at the same time and prioritizeWhat's In It for YouBase Salary $160,000-$250,000 DOE-15 Paid Vacation Days-Paid personal time off (PTO): 2 Days-Prodigy Network offers excellent benefits upon your second month of employmentincluding medical, dental, vision, EAP, and 401KSo, if you are a CFO/VP of Finance with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Manager, Corporate Finance
Description:
If you are an Corporate Finance Manager with English and Korean Language proficiency, please read on!We are one of the world's largest fashion and cosmetics brands manufacturers committed to providing high-quality products and services with a focus on industry safety and innovation. Known globally for our excellence in multiple cosmetic categories, fashionable colors and iconic names, we believe great gifts often come in small packages. We are seeking an awesome Manager, Corporate Finance and or Accounting to join our team.Top Reasons to Work with Us- Nationally Recognized Fashion and Cosmetics Brand- Excellent Compensation + Bonus Opportunities- Fantastic Team and Notable Leadership- Generous Benefits Package + Vacation/PTO- Outstanding Opportunity to work with an Enterprise OrganizationWhat You Will Be Doing• Analyzing inflows/outflows of cash and using your finding to forecast daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual cash balances• Work with sales, solutions engineering, legal and finance teams to understand customer needs and develop strategy for the proposal response• Executing/processing financial transactions• Maintain high level of detail when building quote proposals based on customer data• Investigate/anticipate any increases or decreases in cash versus forecast• Communicating professionally and constructively to effectively resolve issues in order to minimize risk and exposure• Ensuring clients are provided with accurate financial information and ensure the company is in compliance with all banking rules/standards• Providing superior client service, research and resolutionWhat You Need for this Position• At  least 7 years of experience in the Finance/Accounting field• Bilingual in Korean and English• Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of professional accounting principles and practices (US GAAP) and the ability to apply the knowledge• High level of analytical skills with demonstrated ability to synthesize financial and non-financial information in order to develop activity-based costing tools and methodologiesSo, if you are a Corporate Finance Manager looking for an awesome new opportunity, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

comment and make recommendations- Quantify and analyze performance metrics; comment and make recommendationsWhat's In It for You- Full benefits- Direct reports- Small team environment- Competitive compensationSo, if you are a Director of Accounting and Finance with payroll accounting and leadership experience, please apply today!

Interested candidates must have top academic credentials.What's In It for You- Competitive salary- Great company culture - Vacation/Sick Time/Paid Holidays- Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance- 401(k) plan- Child CareSo, if you are a Corporate Associate with 3-5 years of experience, please apply today!

Title: Director of Engineering -TOP PAY! Powerhouse solar finance comp!
Description:
Based in Oakland, CA, we are an innovative, technology-driven provider of solar loans for homeowners, revolutionizing the two biggest industries in the world: energy and finance. Our mission is to enable everyone to prosper from the transition to a world powered by 100% clean energy. We've been covered in Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, Forbes and The New York Times among others.We are looking to add a Director of Engineering to our well established Executive team!Top Reasons to Work with Us-VERY competitive base salary and compelling stock options!- 20% Bonus!-We have a great team consisting of smart, hard-working, passionate people!-Awesome benefits and company culture!What You Will Be Doing-Manage multiple teams of Engineers, with a focus on building a differentiated Point of Sale experience and innovative solutions for the Home Improvement marketSupport Team Leads in effective management of an agile scrum process within each team, in close partnership with Product Managers-Ensure strong collaboration and effective partnership between Engineering and related teams, including DevOps, Product, Test, business stakeholders and external customers-Provide capacity targets and performance reporting for your teams-Ensure that all Engineering projects and initiatives are in conformance with established policies and objectives-Play a leading role in software/platform/application architectural evolution and diagnosing complex issues as they arise-Collaborate with other Engineering and Product leaders to develop cross-team practices and processes that foster a culture of innovation and excellenceWhat You Need for this Position-Minimum 10 years of software development experience with minimum 5 years managing software engineers, preferably across multiple teams-Prior consumer lending experience (banks, lending institutions etc.)-Strong full-stack technical experience, with an emphasis on front-end or web applications-Enthusiasm and demonstrated ability for quickly gaining deep familiarity with your teams’ domains, for the sake of supporting the engineers in building high quality, resilient solutions-Proven success motivating teams to excellence, fostering the leadership and professional development of all individuals-Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, across diverse groups, both technical and non-technical-Comfort in a dynamic, fast-paced environment-Experience with modern software engineering tools and best practices (e.g. Jira, CI/CD, Jenkins, git, distributed systems)Strongly preferred:-Experience building financial services or eCommerce applications with Java and/or Scala-Experience integrating with SalesForce-Working with any of the following, ReactJS, API Development, GraphQL, Responsive Mobile Interfaces-Managing a team of offshore Engineers-Experience with distributed systems, micro-services, event-based architectureWhat's In It for YouCompetitive base salary and equity stake.Full benefitsFun, collaborative work environmentGenerous PTOMany other great perksPlease note, this is an urgent hire for us! Any qualified applicant will be given an interview ASAP. We have the capacity to bring on a qualified candidate immediately.**IF YOU'RE INTERESTED, PLEASE APPLY BELOW OR EMAIL YOUR RESUME TO: melanie.mcelwee@cybercoders.com**

Title: VP Finance/CAO - 300-325k(base) + 65% bonus - NASDAQ Biotech Co.
Description:
If you are a VP Finance/CAO with experience, please read on!Top Reasons to Work with UsWe're a publicly traded company(on the NASDAQ) that operates as a holding company that manages a portfolio of patents and royalty-generating assets, consisting of patents, license agreements with various biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies, and royalty and other assets acquired.  300-325k(base) + 65% Bonus + Long Term Incentive Plan **WILL PROVIDE RELO PACKAGE TO INCLINE VILLAGE, NV for the right candidate**What You Will Be Doing- The VP Finance will be responsible for the day to day finance and accounting functions including financial reporting, presentations to the board and senior management, SEC reporting, SOX compliance, budgeting, forecasting, and preparation and management of quarterly Form 10Q’s, annual Form 10K’s and other SEC financial report. - He/she will serve as a resource for researching and providing clear explanations and guidance for complex accounting issues as they arise and interfacing with external independent auditors.- Perform research, determine financial reporting and disclosure impact, ensure timely adoption, and prepare technical memos to support the Company’s accounting treatment for debt, royalty and other periodic transactions and newly issued accounting pronouncements;- Manage and coordinate annual audit and quarterly reviews with external auditors.- Implement and maintain policies and procedures related to Section 404 Sarbanes Oxley documentation- Prepare monthly subsidiary and consolidated financial statements- Act as an advisor on accounting issues to management and business development advisors, initiate work as a self-starter, learn quickly, work independently and motivate others- Direct and coordinate annual financial planning and budget management functions.- Monitor and analyze monthly operating results against budget and prepare monthly management reports, including reporting and evaluation of investment portfolio- Direct and coordinate debt service payments with external agencies- Oversee daily operations in the accounting department- Coordinate and prepare 10K, 10Q’s and other SEC financial reports- Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal tax and 401K reporting requirements.What You Need for this Position- A CPA and SEC reporting experience is required, and Big 4 public accounting experience is preferred- Experience in life sciences/biotech and/or capital markets/financial services- Strong technical accounting skills with knowledge of SEC reporting rules, regulations and accounting principles- Extensive knowledge and experience in working with revenue recognition issues, and complex debt and equity transactions under GAAP- Understanding and experience with accounting for financial instruments including fair value measurement under GAAP (ASC 820 and 825);What's In It for YouStrong Compensation Package - 300-325k(base) + 65% BonusWork/Life balance that you deserve!Health/Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits + 401(k)Long Term Incentive PlanSo, if you are a VP Finance/CAO with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Skills:
Preferred Skills
                
                    
                            
                                
                                    
                                    CPA

for financial instruments including fair value measurement under GAAP (ASC 820 and 825);What's In It for YouStrong Compensation Package - 300-325k(base) + 65% BonusWork/Life balance that you We are seeking experienced applicants for our corporate practice and are particularly interested in candidates with prior "big law" experience working with start ups and established businesses.This vacancy is for our Santa Rosa and San Francisco office and we are seeking a Corporate Associate with at least 5 years of relevant corporate experience, particularly representing emerging growth technology companies through all stages of their life-cycle including day-to-day counseling through direct interactions, negotiating and advising capital financing's, negotiating strategic transactions and acquisitions. Title: Senior Underwriter - Multifamily
Description:
If you are a Underwriter - Multifamily with experience, please read on!We're seeking a highly-motivated individual experienced in Agency / CMBS / debt underwriting for our commercial real estate advisory services. This is an opportunity to join a fast growing entrepreneurial team in a dynamic environment with our office in North Carolina.The Underwriter is responsible for structuring and underwriting new commercial real estate loans between $1 million and $1 Billion in a manner consistent with client credit parameters, including but not limited to: Freddie Mac Small Balance Loan (SBL), Commercial Mortgage Backed Securities (CMBS), Small Business Administration (SBA), and balance sheet and bridge/transitional property loans. The Senior Underwriter’s goal is to ensure the quality, completeness and accuracy of the analysis that precedes credit and business decisions as well as manage the overall delivery of the transaction to clients.As an Underwriter in commercial real estate, the candidate will work with U.S. and India teams supporting clients in analyzing the real estate collateral securing a proposed loan, the surrounding market/sub-market and demographic area as well as the financial strength and experience of the borrower/guarantor. This role will include the responsibility for making credit worthy decisions on complex commercial real estate transactions to determine acceptability of risk in accordance with the client’s guidelines and standards.What You Will Be DoingThis role will require managing teams across multiple projects and involvement in all aspects of the evaluation process including:- Interacting with clients and maintaining client relationships- Managing the receipt and delivery of loan due diligence to and from the client- Evaluating all financial statements, identifying recurring and non-recurring income/expenses, differentiating between capital expenditure and operating expenses, and understanding cash and accrual methodologies- Analyzing rent rolls and completing financial modeling- Reviewing and analyzing borrower/sponsor searches- Reviewing third party appraisal, engineering and environmental reports- Reviewing and abstracting commercial leases- Writing and reviewing all aspects of the credit memorandum and/or asset summary report- Applying a critical eye at each phase of the process and reporting any anomalies to the client- Managing and working on multiple transactions with support from junior underwriters- Managing deadlines, multi-tasking and maintaining high production and quality standards- Allocating resources efficiently based on timelines and workload- Coordinating with closing departments and outside counsel in the preparation, review and approval of loan documentation to ensure the documents meet agreed upon business terms and satisfy the specific requirements of the appropriate credit approval authority- Providing closing support to the client- Supervising junior staff in two offices across countries and time zonesWhat You Need for this Position(1) Multifamily / commercial real estate lending or underwriting, (2) Portfolio management (3) Credit or financial analysis (4) Completion of corporate credit training or a professional development program (5) Commercial real estate acquisitions, (6) Commercial real estate dispositions, (7) Property management, (8) Commercial real estate appraisal, (9) Commercial real estate market research- Master’s degree preferably in business with finance or accounting concentration- 5+ years of hands-on real estate finance experience- Agency / CMBS and/or capital markets debt underwriting or credit analysis experience with a lending institution is a strong plus- Strong interpersonal and communication (verbal & written) skills. The candidate must possess strong ability to write in a concise and clear manner to convey complex information- Must be self-motivated and able to work in teams and individually- Knowledge and experience of credit policy and credit administration procedures- Computer literacy is a must with proficiency in Microsoft Office products- Must be able to work on various third party underwriting systems e.g. Rockport / Backshop or proprietary underwriting systemsSo, if you are a Underwriter - Multifamily with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: CFO - Non-Profit
Description:
If you are a CFO with Non-Profit Financial Operation experience, please read on!What You Will Be Doing• Be a strong strategic partner and thought leader for the CEO, Leadership Team and Board of Trustees• Become aware of industry leading business and funding models and lead efforts to help us develop a program / business model with diversified revenue streamsthat is sustainable and scalable• Meet with current and potential contractors (state, county, city) and third party payers (insurance companies and managed care plans) and thoroughly vet allpotential contracts and revenue sources for return on investment• Proactively and perpetually identify ways to make and/or save us money• Remain aware of trends in our region and industry and inform our strategies based on that knowledge• Financial IT consultation—the ability to improve accounting system IT, finding efficiency in accounting, administrative, and back office processes• Oversee day to day financial operations• Oversee completion of external audits and 990 tax return• Management of procurement (contractors, vendors, electronic health records, banking, insurance, etc.), cost accounting, budgeting, and continuous processimprovements in each• Guide financial decisions by establishing, monitoring and enforcing finance policies and procedures and internal controls• Create, maintain and distribute comprehensive and timely budgets and dashboards to provide real time data on Key Performance Indicators • Convert numbers and data into advice that enables nonfinancial people to make better-informed decisions• Arrange for internal and external audits as required and necessary• Regularly track and report spend downs on all grants and contracts Risk Management• Ensure compliance with all applicable rules and regulations• Work with consultants and/or board members and other volunteers to do comprehensive internal audits and risk analysis• Regularly advise leadership on areas of liability and risk• Advise, monitor and report on organizational assets and investments• Help determine the highest and best use of organizational real estate / facilities• Follow and role-model HopeSparks policies, procedures and guiding valuesWhat You Need for this PositionMore Than 10 Years of experience and knowledge of:• At least 10 years of nonprofit experience in similar leadership position• Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting or Related field• Master’s Degree preferred• CPA preferred• Audit experience preferred• Experience with Sage Accounting SoftwareJob Conditions• Ability to work in a fast paced and changing working environment• Ability to work on multiple projects at one time• Prolonged computer work at times• Ability to relate to multiple stakeholders (funding sources, city and community groups, clients, staff, volunteers, etc.)So, if you are a CFO with Non-Profit Financial Operation experience, please apply today!

Title: Construction Controller
Description:
If you are a Controller with experience, please read on!Top Reasons to Work with UsThe Corporate Controller/Business Manager will be responsible for managing the daily operations of the accounting department. The candidate must be a self-starter, adaptable to change and possess strong accounting, finance and management backgrounds. Candidate must have experience in the construction industry. The desired candidate will also possess strong organizational, communication and leadership skills. The Controller/Business Manager will report to the Chief Financial Officer.What You Will Be Doing- Primary management of accounting personnel & processes- Manage individuals responsible for payroll, billings, collections, accounts payable and fixed assets- Motivate and mentor the accounting staff, providing them with leadership, direction and coaching to achieve work and individual career objectives.- Regularly meet with staff from each facet of the accounting department to provide training and discuss ideas, concerns, issues, etc.- Provide support and guidance on any significant items that develop in the accounting department- Review accounting processes and evaluate any alternatives that may streamline operations- Create, manage and update accounting policies and procedures and ensure adherence to the same.- Financials & ledger management- Manage the month end close & account reconciliation process- Assist in Work in Progress reviews with the Chief Financial Officer- Compile all financial reports for review and final distribution- Manage, produce and distribute all subsidiary companies financial reports- Ensure accurate & timely financial records in accordance with GAAP- Audits- Lead Annual Financial Audit- Support other audits as necessary (profit sharing audits, project audits, etc.)- Tax (state, local, federal)-Lead Annual Corporate Tax Reporting- Work with external CPA firm to prepare taxes-Oversee Heavy Highway Tax Reporting-Oversee and assist with Sales & Use Tax reporting-Responsible for all required tax reports/filings ensuring compliance with government and other regulatory agencies-Oversee payroll tax and fringe benefit tax compliance-Assist in annual strategic business planning and budgeting-Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts with management-Ongoing reporting and variance analysis vs the budget-Research and summarize variances-Assist with forecasts as necessary-Cash management-Monitor bank account balances-Execute transfers or wires-Assist with cash flow forecasting when needed-Oversee and perform bank reconciliations-Improve and/or enhance reporting capabilities including designing new reports to support management staff.What You Need for this PositionAt Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:- Construction Industry Experience- Accounting- Finance- HR management- Vista/Viewpoint Construction SoftwareNice to have: - Procore- Smartsheet- G Suite- CPASo, if you are a Controller with experience, please apply today!

Title: Corporate Tax Manager
Description:
If you are a Corporate Tax Manager with experience, please read on!What You Will Be Doing(THIS POSITION REPORTS TO IRVINE, CA)For nearly 30 years, We have provided trusted business advisory services that have extended beyond the traditional auditor or accountant role. We study every client’s business and industry thoroughly and offer insights into becoming more efficient and cost-effective. Our reliable advice and expert solutions for complex financial and transactional matters have established our team as sophisticated accounting, reporting and advisory services providers that compare with national public accounting firms. We augment our expertise with personalized attention to every client because we believe that middle-market companies deserve the same level of service and respect as larger enterprises. With this in mind, we help businesses advance from where they are today to where they want to go.In addition to traditional accounting services, such as tax consulting and planning, auditing, and due diligence for mergers and acquisitions, We assist clients with Sarbanes-Oxley compliance, preparation for IPOs, and ongoing SEC filings. We are particularly well-versed in the real estate, manufacturing and distribution, technology, life sciences, and non-profit sectors.Drawing on their base of five to eight years of experience, Managers at our Firm are responsible for handling several client engagements simultaneously, as well as maintaining client relationships and developing a referral network for business development. Our Managers possess a high-level understanding of business and industry concepts, and use these as a foundation for providing proactive advice to current and prospective clients.What You Need for this PositionMore Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:- CPA- Corporate Tax- FIN 48- FAS 109- FinanceSo, if you are a Corporate Tax Manager with experience, please apply today!

Title: Chief Strategic Partnership Officer- Top Fintech Company
Description:
This is NOT A CFO/COO or other administrative type role. This role is specifically for management of our strategic relationships with other Fintech platforms for the purposes of acquiring new partnerships and broadening existing ones. High LEVEL of technological sophistication with previous Fintech platforms a HUGE plus!Top Reasons to Work with Us-Top Compensation for the right candidateWhat You Will Be DoingThis is an exciting opportunity to provide strong leadership and a valuable contribution to an organization that is on the edge of breakthrough in the global financial market. Working under a highly visionary CEO who is also an acknowledged world class expert in the fields of specialty finance and technology, one of the CSPO’s main tasks during the first 24 months of his/her tenure will be to manage the deployment of Lending as a Service platform. He/she will be able to rely on a team of the highest caliber both in terms of technology and specialty finance and fully dedicated to the success of this uniquely exciting venture.The CSPO should be an ambitious leader with proven skills and experience in the areas of finance and technology – a must. Working alongside a deeply motivated team and an engaged and highly experienced Board of Directors, the CSPO will help the CEO manage the exponential growth of the business.Ideal candidates will possess a high level of financial and business acumen, collaboration and teamwork, and a proven track record of operational excellence. He/she will need to display a clear ability to adapt to fast changing environments and circumstances. He/she will be expected to travel both within the US as well as abroad.Requirements:Manage complex medium to large projects, negotiating cross-border strategic partnerships and developing new market entry opportunitiesEnsure projects systematically delivered on time, on budget, and to the agreed scopeIdentify risk mitigation strategies on an ongoing basis and detect and solve issues as they ariseTurn strategic objectives into specific tasks, build timelines, set milestone and lead/oversee executionSupervise the team and manage communication with all stakeholdersEstablish and maintain working relationship with senior technology & business executives on daily basisWhat You Need for this PositionWork Experience:5-7 years’ experience working within financial services environment with a proven record of project ownership, accountability and evidence of driving successful deliverySolid understanding of technology and strong experience in financial services sectorKnowledge and understanding of banking regulation & compliance and security aspects a “plus”Ability to build and motivate a cohesive and effective team regardless of physical location and cultural backgrounds. Ability to build partnerships with senior industry leadersQualifications:Graduate (Master’s or higher) degree in business/finance or related areaStrong lending/financing experience a plusEvidence of solid understanding of technologySo, if you are a Chief Strategic Partnership Officer with experience, please apply today!

Title: Corporate Tax Manager
Description:
If you are a Corporate Tax Manager with experience, please read on!What You Will Be Doing(CPA REQUIRED POSITION REPORTS TO KIRKLAND WA AND REQUIRES RELOCATION OR A COMMUTABLE DISTANCE)For nearly 30 years, We have provided trusted business advisory services that have extended beyond the traditional auditor or accountant role. We study every client’s business and industry thoroughly and offer insights into becoming more efficient and cost-effective. Our reliable advice and expert solutions for complex financial and transactional matters have established our team as sophisticated accounting, reporting and advisory services providers that compare with national public accounting firms. We augment our expertise with personalized attention to every client because we believe that middle-market companies deserve the same level of service and respect as larger enterprises. With this in mind, we help businesses advance from where they are today to where they want to go.In addition to traditional accounting services, such as tax consulting and planning, auditing, and due diligence for mergers and acquisitions, We assist clients with Sarbanes-Oxley compliance, preparation for IPOs, and ongoing SEC filings. We are particularly well-versed in the real estate, manufacturing and distribution, technology, life sciences, and non-profit sectors.Drawing on their base of five to eight years of experience, Managers at our Firm are responsible for handling several client engagements simultaneously, as well as maintaining client relationships and developing a referral network for business development. Our Managers possess a high-level understanding of business and industry concepts, and use these as a foundation for providing proactive advice to current and prospective clients.What You Need for this PositionAt Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:- CPA- Corporate Tax- FIN 48- FAS 109- FinanceSo, if you are a Corporate Tax Manager with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Multifamily Senior Development Manager - Affordable Housing
Description:
Based out of San Jose, CA we are a Public Company who is an owner/builder who specializes in Multi-Family Construction, Full Design - Build Services, Market Rate Apartment Construction, Wrap and Podium Construction, Pre-Construction Services; and we have already constructed over 2,200 apartments, town-homes, and single family houses in 15 different communities. Our projects range from eight story concrete mid-rise buildings, multi-family apartments over podiums to single family home subdivisions. We are specialists in multi-story, multi-family construction over podium and garage wraps. We are accomplished at working with City, County, and State building codes and regulations. Many of our projects have had prevailing wage requirements, city hiring requirements, and First Source hiring requirements and we are comfortable and competent at managing the paperwork and documentation required by the governing agencies.What You Will Be DoingThe position assumes full responsibility for the successful completion of multi-faceted real estate development projects – both market-rate and affordable - from inception through construction completion and lease-up.  This individual is responsible for the strong leadership of an in-house team of Associate Developers, Assistant Developers and Administrative Assistants.  This individual simultaneously assembles and manages an external team of financiers, architects, designers, engineers and contractors. Each developer simultaneously coordinates multiple projects in varying stages of development.  This position demands strong financial skills, creative thinking, leadership, and effective communication.Duties and Responsibilities•Identification and evaluation of real-estate development opportunities•Determination of the financial feasibility for a viable project•Determination of the suitability of a site•Direct report to Pennrose Properties Chief Financial Officer for predevelopment expenditures expectations, development cash-flow, and development capital requirements•Drafting and finalizing multiple, professional RFPs and RFQs•Establishing strong public private partnerships•Delivery of professional Powerpoint presentations before both large and small groups of financiers, municipalities, and community constituents for the purpose of marketing Pennrose Properties to groups potentially skeptical and occasionally adverse•Development of realistic project budgets•Coordination of efficient land-development approval process•Assembly and leadership of superior development team•Coordination of legal team •Responsibility for all site control documentation, loan agreements, equity documents and partnership agreements•Collaboration with architects and Title: Director of Development - For-Profit Affordable Housing
Description:
Based out of San Jose, CA we are a Public Company who is an owner/builder who specializes in Multi-Family Construction, Full Design - Build Services, Market Rate Apartment Construction, Wrap and Podium Construction, Pre-Construction Services; and we have already constructed over 2,200 apartments, town-homes, and single family houses in 15 different communities. Our projects range from eight story concrete mid-rise buildings, multi-family apartments over podiums to single family home subdivisions. We are specialists in multi-story, multi-family construction over podium and garage wraps. We are accomplished at working with City, County, and State building codes and regulations. Many of our projects have had prevailing wage requirements, city hiring requirements, and First Source hiring requirements and we are comfortable and competent at managing the paperwork and documentation required by the governing agencies.What You Will Be DoingThe position assumes full responsibility for the successful completion of multi-faceted real estate development projects – both market-rate and affordable - from inception through construction completion and lease-up.  This individual is responsible for the strong leadership of an in-house team of Associate Developers, Assistant Developers and Administrative Assistants.  This individual simultaneously assembles and manages an external team of financiers, architects, designers, engineers and contractors. Each developer simultaneously coordinates multiple projects in varying stages of development. Title: Corporate Tax Manager
Description:
If you are a Corporate Tax Manager with experience, please read on!What You Will Be DoingFor nearly 30 years, We have provided trusted business advisory services that have extended beyond the traditional auditor or accountant role. We study every client’s business and industry thoroughly and offer insights into becoming more efficient and cost-effective. Our reliable advice and expert solutions for complex financial and transactional matters have established our team as sophisticated accounting, reporting and advisory services providers that compare with national public accounting firms. We augment our expertise with personalized attention to every client because we believe that middle-market companies deserve the same level of service and respect as larger enterprises. With this in mind, we help businesses advance from where they are today to where they want to go.In addition to traditional accounting services, such as tax consulting and planning, auditing, and due diligence for mergers and acquisitions, We assist clients with Sarbanes-Oxley compliance, preparation for IPOs, and ongoing SEC filings. We are particularly well-versed in the real estate, manufacturing and distribution, technology, life sciences, and non-profit sectors.Drawing on their base of five to eight years of experience, Managers at our Firm are responsible for handling several client engagements simultaneously, as well as maintaining client relationships and developing a referral network for business development. Our Managers possess a high-level understanding of business and industry concepts, and use these as a foundation for providing proactive advice to current and prospective clients.What You Need for this PositionMore Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:- CPA- Corporate Tax- FIN 48- FAS 109- Finance- Corporate Tax ManagerSo, if you are a Corporate Tax Manager with experience, please apply today!

This position is responsible for input and output, promoting and improving systems, providing proper audit trails, controlling record protection and other related work.What You Will Be Doing- Responsible for accounting staff supervision and development.- Develop, document and maintain processes and accounting to ensure compliance with GAAP.- Manage and comply with all reporting requirements and tax filings- Assist CFO reviewing and documentation of all adjustments and write offs to patient accounts- Participate in the preparation of the annual audit, cost reports, UDS, OSHPD and internal reports- Assist in the development of agency budgets- Oversee preparation of grant budgets and grant fiscal compliance.- Responsible for agency contracts and grant budget work sheetsWhat You Need for this Position- BA degree in accounting/finance- Eight (8) years of experience in finance and accounting procedures including audits and full general ledger oversight.- Experience in 2nd and 3rd party billing for medical organizations preferred- Four (4) years of supervisory experience in an accounting or finance department preferred- Valid California Driver's License, proof of automobile insurance and personal transportationNice to have:- Knowledge of CPT and ICD-10 codingSo, if you are a Controller coming from a healthcare/medical background, please apply today!

Title: ERP Systems Administrator
Description:
If you are a ERP Systems Administrator with experience, please read on!...Founded in the 1990's, we are a pharmaceutical company committed to the discovery, development and commercialization of innovative small molecules for treating infectious diseases and cancers. Our people share a passion for scientific discovery and a desire to make a difference in the world's health. Throughout all phases of drug discovery and development, we are teamed in a quest to provide new treatments for diseases that impact the lives of people worldwide. The Company uses a proprietary technology platform to discover small molecules targeting cell signaling pathways. This research has led to the discovery of a new class of drugs called the thiazolides. The first thiazolide, nitazoxanide, is already commercialized in the United States. Other new compounds and uses are being developed as part of several collaborative research programs.What You Will Be DoingThis role reports to the IT Director. Work is in our Tampa office 85% of the time. The other 15% of the time is traveling to our other sites in Europe and Puerto Rico. Our ERP has just expanded and we are currently undergoing implementations. This is a new role due to expansion. We have just rolled out the financial piece of our ERP and manufacturing will be next, along with maintenance, inventory control, and other modules. The chosen candidate needs to have sys admin, reporting, and ERP experience. •Participate in the design, development, customization, and support efforts of current ERP system as well as lead the migration and integration efforts•Create and maintain user profiles and security roles as they relate to ERP system and the ability to provide audit reports on demand to meet business and regulatory requirements•Responsible for Installing, Configuring, and Maintaining the software installation and update process on all users' desktops and virtual environments•Develop and maintains reports (SQL, Crystal Reports) ad implements dashboards•Write Scripts and queries for business applications, interface scripts, third party integrations and applications of the like that interface with the Ross system•Monitor systems and databases to ensure uptime and quality•Responsible for ensuring backups and disaster recovery procedures are functioning properly•Responsible for testing backup and recovery strategies to ensure business uptime and reliability•Installs and maintains third-party software interfaces with the ERP System•Codes application interfaces and data transfer mechanisms as required to support and integrate business applicationsWhat You Need for this Position- Ability to travel to our other sites in Europe and Puerto Rico 15% of the year- ERP experience- Sys admin experience within an ERP system; including Crystal Reports reporting, maintenance, inventory control, migrations, financial, configuration, implementationWhat's In It for You- Competitive base salary and overall compensation package- Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision- 401 (K) with generous company match- Generous Paid time off (PTO)- Vacation, sick, and paid holidays- Life Insurance coverageSo, if you are a ERP Systems Administrator...1. Apply directly to this job opening here!Or2. E-mail directly for more information to marks@cybercoders.com
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Senior Fund Accountant
Description:
If you are a Senior Fund Accountant with experience with Big 4 or Public/private combo experience, please read on!We are a  private investment and asset management group are seeking a Senior Fund Accountant who will provide key support to the Finance Team on all financial matters and reporting related to the debt and loan servicing divisions. This position will report to the CFO and will be responsible for performing the fund accounting functions for investment partnerships andaccounts managed by the Firm.What You Will Be Doing- Reconcile and manage cash projections- Prepare capital calls, distributions, and management fee calculations- Prepare quarterly closing package and financial statements- Manage quarterly valuation process- Maintain line of credit, including borrowings, paydowns, interest accruals- Coordinate annual audit and tax process- Manage investor reporting, including capital statements and investor letters- Maintain IR functions, including marketing materials and investor inquiries- Work with the firm’s compliance administrator to oversee compliance and other regulatory activities.- Assist with the books and records of GP’s and upper tier entitiesWhat You Need for this PositionMore Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field- 3-5 years of experience in Venture Capital, Private Equity, Hedge Funds, Fund Admin, etc.- Experience with Limited Partnership Agreements- Advanced Microsoft Office skills- Experience with Xero and Quickbooks- Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision making skills- Excellent organizational skills- The ability to multitask to meet multiple deadlinesIf you are a Senior Fund Accountant with experience with Big 4 or Public/private combo experience, please read on!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer- Python(Django) & JavaScript
Description:
Based in San Francisco, we are an early stage startup carving out a niche within the financial investing space.   We have a great product you can truly stand behind. Our executive team is comprised of established internet veterans, supported by top-tier investors and advisors, and we generating significant revenue.  Due to growth and a recent round of funding was are currently looking to add an exceptional Fullstack Software Engineer with strong Python and Front-end experience to our fast-paced and productive engineering team.Top Reasons to Work with Us- Beautiful San Francisco location- Cutting edge technology environment- Great work environment + flexible work hoursWhat You Will Be Doing- Design and write production-ready code and unit tests meeting both technical and business requirements- Optimize and enhance systems with high-volume data logging and processing needs, and high performance requirements- Contribute architecture input to new systems as well as rewrite legacy systems- Contribute domain-specific expertise by reviewing code, reviewing design docs, giving technical talks, and mentoring junior members of the team- Help support the operation of our production servicesWhat You Need for this Position- 3 + years of professional software development experience producing web-based systems in a Linux environment- Extensive development experience in Python- Strong Front End Development skills- A passion for software development, excited to teach and learn from others on a small team- Solid understanding and practical experience using object-oriented design principles and patterns- Experience using an RDBMS such as MySQL and comfortable enough with SQL to do more than simple selects from tables- MVC web framework (Django, Flask, Angular, React, etc.)- Consumer Internet product experience preferred- Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, or equivalentWhat's In It for You- Competitive Compensation Package (130-160k)- Benefits- PTO!- Equity (1-2%)- and MUCH MUCH MORE!So, if you are a Superstar Python Engineer with strong JavaScript and front end experience, apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Senior Backend Engineer- Python, Django, REST API, AWS, Postgres
Description:
If you are a Software Engineer with Backend focus utilizing Python, Django (or Flask), SQL, PostgreSQL, AWS, and REST APIs, please read on!Based in San Francisco, we are an early stage startup carving out a niche within the financial investing space with a great product and leadership that you can truly stand behind. Our executive team is comprised of established internet veterans, supported by top-tier investors and advisors, and we generating significant revenue.  Due to growth and a recent round of funding was are currently looking to add an exceptional Backend Software Engineer with advanced Python development experience and proficiency with Django/Flask, SQL, PostgreSQL, AWS, and JavaScript.   You must be willing to get your hands dirty and able to be productive in our fast-paced environment.Top Reasons to Work with Us- Beautiful San Francisco location- Cutting edge technology environment- Great work environment + flexible work hoursWhat You Will Be Doing- build and enhance the infrastructure that supports a high quality investing platform with a focus on automation and addition of new features- You will work closely with the product, design, and engineering teams. - Scale the platform to the next level.- Make a direct impact on the company’s future by driving the set of features that make us a leading FinTech companyWhat You Need for this PositionRequired:- 3 + years of Backend Software development experience - Solid understanding and practical experience using object-oriented design principles and patterns- Advanced with Python- Experience with Python frameworks such as Django or Flask- Front End Development skills with JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5- Experienced with Relational Databases such as PostgreSQL (Preferred) or MySQL - Comfortable enough with SQL to do more than simple selects from tablesNice to have skills, NOT REQUIRED:- JavaScript frameworks (Angular.js, React.js, Node.js, etc.)- Consumer Internet product experience - Start-up experience- Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, or equivalentWhat's In It for You- Competitive Compensation Package ($120 - $150k)- Benefits- PTO- Equity- Performance Bonus- and MUCH MUCH MORE!So, if you are a Superstar Python Engineer with strong JavaScript and front end experience, apply today!
